title: How to Measure Wrist Size
steps: Measure your wrist circumference just above the bone.
Find your height using a tape measure or ruler.
Compare your wrist measurement to your height using a body frame size chart.

title: How to Measure Heel Height
steps: Measure the length of your foot with a ruler or tape measure.
Divide your foot length by 7.
Determine if the heel height is right for you.

title: How to Measure Leg Length
steps: Find a friend to help you measure your legs.
Lay down on a flat surface.
Measure from your hip to your ankle.
Follow up with a clinician if you find a major discrepancy.

title: How to Measure Boot Shaft
steps: Sit with your foot flat.
Measure up the back of your leg.
Measure around your calf.
Estimate an ideal boot shaft height.

title: How to Buy a Hanging Light for a Dining Room
steps: Measure your dining room.
Take the size of your dining room table into account.
Consider the visual weight of the hanging light when choosing a size.
Choose a style that complements your dining room décor.
Shop around.

title: How to Measure Stride Length
steps: Measure your height to the closest centimeter.
Multiply your height by 0.413 to find stride length for females.
Multiply your height by 0.415 to determine stride length for males.

title: How to Use a White Cane
steps: Obtain a suitable cane of the right length for your height.
Use the cane with whichever hand feels most comfortable.
Understand the parts of a cane.
Handle the cane.
Know how to walk.
Know how to use the stairs.
Practice using a cane; it takes a while to get used to.

title: How to Work out Your Fitness Age
steps: Search on the Internet to find a site that will measure fitness age according to the data above and your height, weight and actual age.
Use your newly calculated fitness age as a starting point for your fitness regimen.

title: How to Tell if One Leg Is Shorter
steps: Find a friend who would like to assist with the tests.
Lay in a supine position on your back with your legs extended.
Rock your hips from side to side for 15 seconds.
Have your friend perform gentle traction on your legs.
Compare the anklebones by placing the thumbs directly over them and seeing if the thumbs are at an even level.
Flex the feet to see if the soles of the feet match up.
Sit up and extend your legs.
Bend your knees and bring them to the exact same position on the bed.
Visit a doctor to repeat these tests with a trained professional.

title: How to Get Rid of Leg Pain
steps: Schedule an appointment with your doctor for a diagnosis.
Describe the location, type, and characteristics of your leg pain.
Ask about treatment options.

title: How to Identify Sciatica
steps: Visit your doctor to receive a comprehensive medical assessment.
Receive a physical examination from your doctor.
Get a straight leg raise test done to identify sciatica.
Undergo additional diagnostic testings.
